cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 mi S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas today–Thursday and forecast to run very close to the southeast and east-central Florida coast Thursday evening through Friday before lifting north along the southeast U.S. shoreline.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the southeast Florida coast (around North Palm Beach/Cape Canaveral area) – landfall or very close pass

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of the Flagler/Volusia county line to Fernandina Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from North of Golden Beach to the Flagler/Volusia county line, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and east-central Florida coastline from Miami-Dade through Palm Beach and up to Volusia County
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts possible; sustained tropical-storm-force winds likely Thursday night–Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the Palm Beach County coast if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated totals near 10 inches possible, leading to flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible port entrance shoaling and debris from wave action.
